comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content: Fascinating to see these early images before the temples were properly excavated. I've actually stood at the feet of the right hand statue (who I was told at the time was Hatshepsut, the Female Pharoah!) which here must be buried a good 10-15 foot below the surface!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Hi *Veriditas*,
It's from an undated group of lantern slides that Professor Goodyear gathered to use for his lectures. His dates are 1846-1923; his work at the Brooklyn Institute and Brooklyn Museum started in 1890 -- so it's dated sometime in that period. Sorry not to be able to be more specific!
For more information about Goodyear and his work, follow the Goodyear Archival Collection link above and then click on "finding aid."
Deb Wythe
Digital Lab
